item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Stats under the Stars (an Italian Statistical Society competition): best report (2017) academic services session organizer and chair of the “ECDA 2022: European Conference on Data Analysis” (2022) co-editor of “Book of Short Papers of SIS 2022” (2022) national coordinator (2022) and member of the national board of young SIS (2021-2022) programme committee member of “SIS 2022: the 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society” (2022) programme committee member of the conference “IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: contact
item.description: email cavicchia@ese.eur.nl personal page dr. Carlo Cavicchia address Room ET-02, P.O. Box 1738, 3000 DR Rotterdam, The Netherlands Tel. +31 010 4081253

item.title: events
item.description: future conferences ECDA 2022: European Conference on Data Analysis (September 14-16, 2022) MBC2 2022: 6th International Workshop on Models and Learning for Clustering and Classification (August 31 - September 2, 2022) COMPSTAT 2022: 24th Internation Conference on Computational Statistics (August 23-26, 2022) IFCS 2022: 17th Conference of the Internation Federation of Classication Societies (July 19-23, 2022) DSSV 2022: Data Science Statistics and Visualisation (June 27-29, 2022) SIS 2022: 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (June 22-24, 2022) IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: materials and info
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve practical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects seminars and talks events teaching material

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current research consists of: Hierarchical Disjoint Principal Component Analysis (Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G.) Revision requested A new ranking calculation based on a composite indicator model: the case of the top 20 European football teams (Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P.) Under review Hierarchical Means Clustering (Vichi, M., Cavicchia, C. and Groenen, P.J.F.) Under review How much do Knowledge about and Attitude toward mobile phone use affect Behavior while driving?

item.title: publications
item.description: refereed journal articles Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G. Gaussian mixture model with an extended ultrametric covariance structure Advances in Data Analysis and Classification, (2022) Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P. The effect of a new e-tivity on students’ performance and satisfaction in an online course Statistica Applicata - Italian Journal of Applied Statistics, 33 (2), pp.163-175 (2021) Cavicchia, C. and Vichi, M. Second-order Disjoint Factor Analysis

item.title: seminars and talks
item.description: seminars and invited talks Introduction to Statistics - Series of seminar within the Hospitality Management bsc degree course of Federico II University of Naples (2022 - Virtual) Cost and performance: a composite indicator for separated waste collection in Italy - ISI 2021 International Statistical Institute World Statistics Congress “Statistics and Data Science for a Better World” (2021 - Virtual) Hierarchical Disjoint Nonnegative Factor Analysis - EconJobMarket Erasmus University Rotterdam (2019 - Rotterdam, Netherlands)

item.title: teaching material
item.description: supervisions I am currently supervising three msc theses in Econometrics and three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics at Erasmus School of Economics the last two years I supervised three msc theses in Econometrics (on mixed-type data clustering methods), three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics (on supervised machine learning methods), and fourteen bsc theses in Econometrics (on Adachi and Trendafilov (2018), Vichi and Kiers (2001) and Bluszcz (2016)) at Erasmus School of Economics
